intro: Calycogonium apleurum, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that resemble those of the buttercup. The plant has basal leaves that are lobed and hairy, and its stems are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Calycogonium apleurum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
